{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{Use South African English|date=November 2012}} '''Richard John Pelwana Maponya''', [[Order of the Baobab|GCOB]],<ref name="gcob">[http://www.thepresidency.gov.za/orders_list.asp?show=343 The Presidency - Republic of South Africa - Grand Counsellor of The Order of the Baobab in Gold]</ref> (born in [[Tzaneen]],[[Transvaal Province|Transvaal]] on 24 December 1926<ref name="gcob" />) is a [[South Africa]]n entrepreneur and [[property developer]] best known for building a business empire despite the restrictions of [[apartheid]] and his determination to see the [[Soweto]] township develop [[economics|economically]].
==Early career== Born in Thlabine, near Lenyenye- about 20km west of Tzaneen, Maponya, at the age of 24,<ref name="age">zwtetete [https://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20081004/ap_on_re_af/af_south_africa_soweto_entrepreneur Up from apartheid, Soweto millionaire a role model - AP]</ref> then a teacher, took a job as a stock taker at a clothing maker and subsequently won a promotion for both himself and his white manager. In gratitude, the manager sold Maponya soiled clothing and offcuts, which he resold in Soweto. With the capital acquired he attempted to open a clothing retailer in Soweto, but was blocked by the government's refusal to grant him a licence – despite the intervention by the law firm created by [[Oliver Tambo]] and [[Nelson Mandela]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1657164,00.html|title=Retail Renegade: Richard Maponya|publisher=Time magazine|accessdate=7 July 2008 | date=29 August 2007}}</ref>
Instead, in the early 1950s, Maponya and his wife Marina (a cousin of Nelson Mandela) established the [[Dube Hygienic Dairy]], which employed a fleet of boys on bicycles to deliver milk to customers in Soweto who had no access to electricity or refrigeration.<ref name="ReferenceA">Soweto Rising, [[Maverick (magazine)|Maverick magazine]], volume 2, issue 2</ref> By the 1970s the retail empire had grown to include several general stores, car dealerships and filling stations.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1657164-2,00.html|title=Retail Renegade: Richard Maponya|publisher=Time magazine|accessdate=7 July 2008 | date=29 August 2007}}</ref>
==Political activity== During the 1960s and 1970s Maponya was a member of the [[South Africa under apartheid|Urban Bantu Council]]. He resigned in 1977, shortly after youth affiliated with the [[African National Congress]] (ANC) requested that he do so, and shortly before the council offices were burnt to the ground.<ref name="ReferenceA"/>
In the 1960s he was a founding member and the first president of the [[National African Federated Chamber of Commerce]] (Nafcoc) and likewise the founder and chairman of the [[African Chamber of Commerce]].
But some consider his boldest political move to have been his choice of horse-racing colors. As the first black person to be granted such colors in South Africa, Maponya chose green, gold and black, the colors of the ANC.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mg.co.za/article/2005-08-17-i-will-die-with-my-boots-on|title='I will die with my boots on'|publisher=Mail & Guardian|accessdate=7 July 2008}}</ref>
==Maponya Mall== On 27 September 2007 Richard Maponya opened the [[Maponya Mall]] in Soweto. it holds more than 200 stores and a cinema complex.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sabcnews.com/south_africa/general/0,2172,156535,00.html|title=Mandela officially opens new Soweto mall|publisher=SABC|accessdate=7 July 2008}}</ref>
Maponya acquired the land where the mall is situated in 1979, at first as a 100-year lease. In 1994, after several attempts, he acquired it outright. Various attempts to finance construction failed until Maponya's holding company entered into a joint venture with [[Zenprop Property Holdings]].
==Awards== [[Order of the Baobab|Grand Counselor of the Baobab]], April 2007<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.info.gov.za/aboutgovt/orders/recipients/2007apr.htm|title=National Orders awards 24 April 2007|publisher=SA Government Communication and Information Service|accessdate=7 July 2008}}</ref>

{{Multiple issues| {{News release|1=article|date=September 2017}} {{COI|date=November 2017}} {{Copypaste|date=November 2017}}}} {{EngvarB|date=November 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2013}} '''Sean J. Conlon''' is an Irish-American businessman, real estate entrepreneur, investor, television personality and philanthropist. He grew up in [[Rathangan, County Kildare]], [[Ireland]] before moving to Chicago.
He is currently chairman and founder of Conlon & Co, CONLON/Christie's International Real Estate, CONLON Commercial and Conlon Capital. He is a co-host of ''The Deed'', an unscripted television series focused on real estate investing on [[CNBC]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2017/08/03/cnbc-announces-fall-lineup.html|title=CNBC ANNOUNCES FALL LINE UP|date=3 August 2017|website=CNBC.COM}}</ref>
==Biography== Conlon was born in [[Birmingham, England]] to Irish parents and raised in [[Rathangan, County Kildare]], [[Ireland]]. Before migrating to America in 1990, Conlon attended the [[Dublin Institute of Technology|College of Marketing and Design, Dublin]] and worked as a credit analyst for Lehman Brothers in London.{{cn|date=November 2017}}
===Business career=== In 1993, he joined Koenig & Strey and within a few years, Sean became recognized as one of the leading sellers of residential real estate in the U.S.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://realtormag.realtor.org/sales-and-marketing/success-stories/article/2000/06/top-performer-sean-conlon|title=Top Performer: Sean Conlon|last=Sharoff|first=Robert|website=Realtor Magazine|language=en|access-date=2017-01-27}}</ref> He set yearly sales records nationally among real estate agents that exceeded $150 million.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://realtormag.realtor.org/sales-and-marketing/success-stories/article/2000/06/top-performer-sean-conlon|title=Top Performer: Sean Conlon|last=Sharoff|first=Robert|website=Realtor Magazine|access-date=2017-01-27}}</ref>
Conlon made his name buying small homes and replacing them with three-story [[condominium]]s and [[single family homes]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://realtormag.realtor.org/sales-and-marketing/success-stories/article/2000/06/top-performer-sean-conlon|title=Top Performer: Sean Conlon|last=Sharoff|first=Robert|website=Realtor Magazine|accessdate=2017-01-27}}</ref>
Previously in [[Chicago]], builders created developments and brought them to [[estate agent]]s who sold them, but Conlon devised a new formula where he found the land, architect, builders and then marketed the entire project.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://conlonandco.com/node/38|title=Birth of a Salesman|last=Allen|first=Ted|date=1 February 1998|work=Chicago Magazine}}</ref>
In January 2000, Conlon formed Sussex & Reilly ("Sussex"), an Illinois-based real estate brokerage firm. The firm began with a 10-person staff and quickly became a major player in Chicago residential real estate.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://realtormag.realtor.org/for-brokers/feature/article/2001/06/brokers-breaking-ground|title="Brokers Breaking Ground"|last=Sharoff|first=Robert|date=June 2001|work=Realtor Magazine}}</ref> Sussex grew to over 300 employees and annual brokerage sales volume in excess of $1 billion. He subsequently sold Sussex in 2006. Since 2002, Conlon has been a partner of Van & Conlon, which has built and developed 100 vacation homes. In 2004, in partnership, he acquired Near North National Title, which was established in 1988, and handles up to $5 billion in real estate transactions annually across the US. He sold Near North in February 2010. In 2005, Sean launched Connaught Real Estate Finance, a $100 million mezzanine fund that lends money to developers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://chicagoagentmagazine.com/current-issue/vol-10-2013/whos-who-2013/steve-horvath-and-sean-conlon|title=Steve Horvath and Sean Conlon - Chicago Agent Magazine|website=Chicagoagentmagazine.com|accessdate=3 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chicagorealestatedaily.com/article/20130716/CRED0701/130719877?template=mobile&X-IgnoreUserAgent=1|title=Conlon seeks boost from Christie's brand|website=Chicagorealestatedaily.com|accessdate=3 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://my.chicagotribune.com/#section/-1/article/p2p-77629469|title=Chicago Tribune|website=My.chicagotribune.com|accessdate=3 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chicagobusiness.com/cgi-bin/news.pl?id=27047|title=Irish investors buying local retail properties|website=Chicagobusiness.com|accessdate=3 November 2017}}</ref>
In 2009, he returned to residential real estate brokerage. In June 2013, CONLON became affiliated with one of the world’s real estate networks, [[Christie's International Real Estate|Christie’s International Real Estate]]. [[Christie's]] is one of the oldest privately held brands in the world. Their International Real Estate division specializes in high-end properties and has offices worldwide, including London, Sydney, Italy, New York and Hong Kong, and Chicago. CONLON is the Christie’s exclusive affiliate in Chicago.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://video.cnbc.com/gallery/?play=1&video=3000203923|title=Tour multi-million dollar homes in Dallas, Chicago|website=CNBC|accessdate=3 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://chicago.suntimes.com/news/kapos-chicagos-celebrity-house-flipper|title=Kapos: Chicago's celebrity house-flipper|website=Chicago.suntimes.com|accessdate=3 November 2017}}</ref>
In 2017, he launched Conlon Capital, which focuses on commercial real estate lending,<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/bisnow/2017/01/11/aries-capital-conlon-merger-aims-to-create-top-5-u-s-financing-house/#38bc2bfaaca0|title=Aries Capital, Conlon Merger Aims To Create Top 5 U.S. Financing House|last=Sudo|first=Chuck|date=11 January 2017|work=Forbes|access-date=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}</ref>
===Television Personality=== In November 2016, [[CNBC]] announced that Sean would be the co-host of its newest show ''[[The Deed]]'' which premiered in March 2017. "The eight-episode one-hour series will follow Torres in New Orleans and Conlon in Chicago as they throw distressed developers a lifeline by offering them their own cash and expertise in exchange for a piece of the property and a percentage of the profits."<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2016/11/22/cnbc-greenlights-new-primetime-real-estate-investment-series-the-deed.html|title=CNBC Greenlights New Primetime Real Estate Investment Series 'The Deed'|last=CNBC|date=2016-11-22|website=CNBC|access-date=2017-01-27}}</ref>
The first of four episodes of ''The Deed: Chicago'' premiered on 29 March 2017 with subsequent episodes on the three following Wednesdays. the show consistently ranked in Showbuzzdaily's Top 150 Original Cable Telecasts and rated as high as the top 15 for its time slot<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-wednesday-cable-originals-network-finals-3-29-2017.html|title=ShowBuzzDaily|website=Showbuzzdaily.com|accessdate=2 November 2017}}</ref>.
In August 2017, [[CNBC]] announced that ''The Deed: Chicago'' was being renewed for a second season to air in 2018<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2017/08/03/cnbc-announces-fall-lineup.html|title=CNBC Announces Fall Lineup; Greenlights New Series and Returning Favorites; Expands Development Slate|access-date=2 November 2017}}</ref>

born 1949, [[Poland]]) - a Polish-born Israeli businessman and the owner of Eurocom Group, one of the largest private [[holding company|holding groups]] in Israel.<ref>{{cite web|title=Eurocom Group|url=http://www.bdicode.co.il/CodeFiles/Company/profiles/Eurocom_eng.pdf|work=[[Coface]]|publisher=BdiCoface|accessdate=15 November 2011}}</ref>
== Background == Shaul Elovitch was born in 1949 in [[Poland]] and made [[aliyah]] to [[Israel]] when he was two years old. He grew up in [[Tel Aviv]] and married at the age of 20. In 1968, shortly after completing his military service, he joined his father-in-law's small business of installing [[intercom]]s and [[television antenna]]s and importing telephones. For a time he studied law but did not complete the requirements for the degree, preferring instead to devote himself to his business pursuits.<ref>{{cite news|last=Sadeh|first=Shuki|script-title=he:משכיר לאימפריה: המסלול העסקי של שאול אלוביץ'|url=http://www.themarker.com/markets/1.539795|accessdate=14 November 2011|newspaper=[[TheMarker]]|date=28 August 2009|language=Hebrew|trans-title=From employee to empire: the corporate path of Shaul Elovitch|quote=הוא גדל בתל אביב הקטנה של שנות ה-50 וה-60, ובימי נעוריו החל לצאת עם מירה פרונאי, שעמה התחתן בגיל צעיר.}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Peretz|first=Gad|title=10 דברים שלא ידעתם על שאול אלוביץ'|url=http://www.globes.co.il/news/article.aspx?did=1000508110|accessdate=14 November 2011|newspaper=[[Globes]]|date=25 October 2009|language=Hebrew|trans-title=10 things you never knew about Shaul Elovitch|quote=אלוביץ' למד משפטים, אך לא השלים את התואר כי העדיף להתרכז בניהול ר.א.פ.}}</ref>
== From R.A.P. to Eurocom == As manager of his father-in-law's company, R.A.P., the young Elovitch was also involved in the distribution of products by a telephone manufacturing company called Eurocom. Eurocom was established in 1979 to take the place of a telephone plant that had operated with Israeli partnership in Iran until [[Ruhollah Khomeini|Ayatolla Khomeini]]'s rise to power. In 1985, Elovitch acquired Eurocom.<ref>{{cite news|title=Shaul Alovitz - Eurocom|url=http://www.globes.co.il/serveen/globes/docview.asp?did=380728|accessdate=15 November 2011|newspaper=[[Globes]]|date=19 December 1999}}</ref>
Partnering with [[Tadiran]], Elovitch became the exclusive distributor in Israel of [[Panasonic]]'s line of office appliances, including telephones, fax machines, xerox machines, and printers, through Eurocom Marketing (1986) Ltd. Next, in 1993, Elovitch signed a distribution deal with [[Nokia]] making him their exclusive distributor in Israel. A year later [[Cellcom (Israel)|Cellcom]] entered Israel's cellular network arena and became a client of Eurocom's Nokia phones, and together the two rivaled [[Pelephone]]'s Motorola-based dominance of Israel's mobile phone market.<ref>{{cite news|last=Kurz|first=Amir|script-title=he:סתם, כי בא לו לדבר|url=http://www.calcalist.co.il/local/articles/0,7340,L-3416854,00.html|accessdate=17 November 2011|newspaper=[[Calcalist]]|date=6 September 2010|language=Hebrew|trans-title=For no reason other than he likes to talk|quote=אלוביץ', עם תדיראן שנכנסה איתו אז כשותפה ב־50%, החל לשווק בארץ באופן בלעדי מוצרים של פנסוניק היפנית באמצעות יורוקום שיווק: טלפונים, מרכזיות, פקסימיליות, מכונות צילום, מדפסות, מחשבים וכו'.}}</ref>
== Bezeq acquisition == After various attempts to establish himself in Israel's communication sector since the late 1990s, including a failed move to compete with [[Bezeq]] through a company named Ofek, in 2009 it was reported that Shaul Elovitch was seriously contemplating the acquisition of either Bezeq or [[Partner Communications Company]]. Later that year it was announced that Elovitch had opted for a deal with the former.<ref>{{cite news|title=Eurocom's Elovitch mulls Bezeq or Partner acquisition|url=http://www.tmcnet.com/usubmit/2009/05/31/4203645.htm|accessdate=15 November 2011|newspaper=TMCnet.com|date=31 May 2009|agency=[[Globes]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Elovitch's straight flush|url=http://www.thestreet.com/story/10003917/1/elovitchs-straight-flush.html|accessdate=25 November 2011|newspaper=[[TheStreet.com]]|date=13 November 2001|agency=[[TheMarker]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Teig|first=Amir|title=Elovitch to buy Bezeq|url=http://www.haaretz.com/print-edition/business/elovitch-to-buy-bezeq-1.5544|accessdate=15 November 2011|newspaper=[[Haaretz]]|date=23 October 2009}}</ref> On 14 April 2010 the ownership of Bezeq was transferred from the Apax-[[Haim Saban|Saban]]-Arkin group to an indirect subsidiary of Eurocom, [[B Communications]].<ref>{{cite news|title=B Communications Closes Acquisition Of Controlling Interest In Bezeq - Quick Facts|url=http://www.rttnews.com/content/BreakingNews.aspx?Id=1268972|accessdate=15 November 2011|newspaper=[[RTTNews]]|date=14 April 2010}}</ref>
== Spacecom == Spacecom Satellite Communications Ltd. (TASE:SCC) was launched in 1993 and is the operator of Amos communication satellites in Israel.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/business/1.693292|title=Israeli satellite operator Spacecom on the selling block again|website=haaretz.com|access-date=2016-11-24}}</ref> The company has a market cap of NIS 1,1 billion on the Tel Aviv Stock Exchange. In 2015, Spacecom lost contact with AMOS 5, their Russian-built satellite causing a loss of over one third of total company revenue.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.jpost.com/Business-and-Innovation/Tech/Israeli-satellite-company-loses-contact-with-satellite-suffers-heavy-losses-in-stock-exchange-434921|title=Israeli satellite company loses contact with satellite, suffers heavy losses in stock exchange|newspaper=The Jerusalem Post {{!}} JPost.com|access-date=2016-11-24}}</ref> The company, owned by Eurocom and controlled by Bezeq Israeli Telecommunication Co. Ltd. (TASE: BEZQ) has been on the market since 2013. Share prices in the group rose after Elovitch announced an offer from a foreign investor of $285 million.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-foreign-co-in-talks-to-buy-spacecom-for-285m-1001147819|title=Foreign co in talks to buy Spacecom for $285m - Globes English|website=Globes|access-date=2016-11-24}}</ref>

==Professional life== Pestrin Farina studied computer engineering at the [[University of Belgrano]] in 1992. In 1998 he then began working career at the [[Inter-American Development Bank]] (IDB) as a [[Java (programming language)|Java]] and [[Visual Basic]] language developer. In 1999 he became involved in the founding of Patagon.com,<ref name=AAB>{{cite news|url=http://www.laprensa.com.ar/Note.aspx?Note=365749 |title=A stimulus to the creators |publisher=La Prensa |author=Daniel Sousa |date=March 3, 2012 |accessdate=February 17, 2012}}</ref> the world's first [[Direct bank|online bank]], which was later sold to the [[Santander Group|Banco Santander Central Hispano]] for $705 million.<ref name=AAA>{{cite news|url=http://www.ambito.com/noticia.asp?id=592961 |title=En la Web hay muchas burbujas y pocas empresas |publisher=Diario Ambito Financiero |date=July 17, 2011 |accessdate=February 16, 2012}}</ref>

{{About|the apparel brand|the television network|STAR World|robotics|star world|other uses|Star-world (disambiguation){{!}}Star-world}} {{unreferenced|date=January 2014}} {{Infobox company | name = Starworld | logo = <gallery>File:Starworld.jpg</gallery> | type = Private | genre = | foundation = 1990 | founder = | location = Alexandria, Egypt; Warrington, UK | locations = | area_served = | key_people = | industry = Textile - apparel clothing | products = | services = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | assets = | equity = | parent = | subsid = | homepage = [http://www.starworldonline.com www.starworldonline.com] | owner = [http://www.cotton-club-apparel.com www.cotton-club-apparel.com] | footnotes = | intl = }} '''Starworld''' is an apparel brand owned by an international group which owns the Cotton Club that produces apparel and is a marketer and a vertically-integrated manufacturer. The company and brand's manufacturing centre is in [[Alexandria, Egypt]], and the brand has offices in [[Warrington, England|Warrington]] (England), [[Hoofddorp, Holland|Hoofddorp]] (Holland) and [[Nicosia, Cyprus|Nicosia]] (Cyprus).
==Company profile== The brand was first developed in the 1990s and the Cotton Club has sole rights to produce and sell Starworld to the European apparel decoration market. The Cotton Club is a fully certified environmental and ethical factory that is certified [[Worldwide Responsible Apparel Production|WRAP]], SMETA, [[Oeko-tex standard|OEKO-TEX 100 Standard]] and Reach. The factory is also GOTS certified meaning it can produce organic clothing. This has resulted in Starworld clothing being produced under market leading certifications.
The brand uses [[ring spun]] cotton as standard along with the famous long staple Egyptian cotton.
The Starworld brand is used by the Cotton Club for marketing a broad range of apparel essentials:
* Activewear, such as performance sportswear. * Casualwear, such as [[T-shirts]], [[Polar Fleece|fleece]], polo shirts and sweatshirts.

'''Total benefits of ownership (TBO)''' is a calculation that tries to summarise the positive effects of the acquisition of a [[Business plan|plan]].<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.auditmypc.com/tbo.asp|title = TBO Definitions|date = |accessdate = 2015-11-01|website = |publisher = Audit My PC|last = |first = }}</ref> It is an estimate of all the values that will affect a business. It is a financial estimate intended to help buyers and owners determine the direct and indirect benefits of a product or system.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.asiaonline.net/EN/LanguageStudio/BenefitsROIAndTCO.aspx|title = Understanding Return On Investment (ROI) and Total Cost and Benefit of Ownership (TCBO)|date = |accessdate = 2015-10-28|website = Understanding Return On Investment (ROI) and Total Cost and Benefit of Ownership (TCBO)|publisher = Asia Online|last = |first = }}</ref> It is used to determine potential [[Return On Investment|Return on Investment]] (ROI). The usage of TBO may lead to increase in efficiency and productivity of a business, improvements in decision-making or improvements in the workforce. It helps to identify important areas which a business should be focusing on, as well as uncovering the hidden aspects of the decisions made by the firm.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://searchdatacenter.techtarget.com/definition/total-benefit-of-ownership-TBO|title = total benefit of ownership (TBO) definition|date = |accessdate = 2015-10-30|website = |publisher = TechTarget|last = |first = }}</ref>
== Use of concept == TBO goes beyond the initial purpose or implementation benefit to consider the full benefit of a decision or an asset over its [[Product lifetime|useful life]]. A TBO analysis often shows there can be a large difference between the short term benefit to the business and its long term benefit. This can include [[Operating cost|operational cost]] savings, productivity improvements, enhancements to a business’s ability to compete, greater [[employee retention]], increased [[brand equity]] and expanding sales reach.<ref>{{Cite web|url = https://www.fuzebox.com/files/pdf/whitepapers/TCO.pdf|title = Analysing Your web conferencing: Total Cost of Ownership|date = |accessdate = 2015-10-30|website = |publisher = fuzebox|last = |first = }}</ref> For example, a small company can now have access to the rest of the world's markets without the costs of travel. The decisions made from TBO analysis help adding monetary profit into the company's account.<ref>{{Cite web|url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b7FRGdB4EVg|title = How to show Total Benefits of Ownership [tm]|date = |accessdate = 2015-11-01|website = |publisher = Senior Advisory Group|last = |first = }}</ref>
== Importance of TBO == While many companies perform [[Total Cost of Ownership]] (TCO) analysis, TBO is considered to be as important as TCO. TCO aims to minimise the total cost of the business, whereas TBO targets the maximum value of the project. Enterprise decision makers often use both methods to estimate the actual value of an investment or strategic venture.<ref>{{Cite web|url = https://dash.harvard.edu/bitstream/handle/1/3450060/Hart_CostsBenefits.pdf?sequence=4|title = The Costs and Benefits of Ownership: A Theory of Vertical and Lateral Integration|date = |accessdate = 2015-11-02|website = |publisher = Harvard University|last = |first = }}</ref>
When considering a business proposition, the enterprise decision makers always consider other alternatives while deciding whether the original plan is the best. An advantage of using TBO is that it identifies the value of the short term and the long-term benefits of the propositions. This system helps the company to prioritise the importance of each decision. This analysis not only serves as a tool to reduce cost but also as a way to plan the future of the business, in a more detailed and sophisticated way.<ref>{{Cite journal|url = https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007%2Fs11740-011-0313-2|title = Linking total costs and benefits of ownership (TCBO) and process chain simulation for integrated assessment of manufacturing technologies and processes|date = |accessdate = 2015-10-28|doi=10.1007/s11740-011-0313-2|volume=5|pages=557–564 | last1 = Denkena | first1 = B. |journal=Production Engineering}}</ref> For example, a company is considering whether to invest in a long-term project, such as [[infrastructure]]. TBO will consider whether the long-term benefit may outweigh the short-term benefits of [[opportunity cost]]; whether the money spent on investment may have a better alternate purpose, e.g. using the budget to improve training schemes for workers.
== Examples of different industries using Total Benefits of Ownership ==
=== Retailing industry with the use of Internet === The TBO concept is widely used within the web industry. For example, TBO identifies the benefits of using the Internet in a business. These include the exclusion of fixed cost (i.e. rent), as well as the decreasing cost of online advertisement.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.wilsonmar.com/1tco.htm|title = Total Cost and Benefit of Ownership (TCBO)|date = |accessdate = 2015-11-04|website = |publisher = WilsonMar|last = |first = }}</ref>
Some of the key elements incorporated in the benefit of ownership within retailing industry. * Cheaper transportation cost * Increase in global demand for products * Decrease in variable cost ( i.e. cheaper wages) * Benefits of outsourcing
=== Computer and software industries etc<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.nashnetworks.ca/total-cost-of-ownership-tco-of-it.htm|title = Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) of IT|date = |accessdate = 2015-11-02|website = Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) of IT|publisher = Nash Networks Inc|last = |first = }}</ref> === * Software becomes more user-friendly * Quicker data analysis * Greater data storage space
